channel.title: Server compiler error
channel.description:
Im trying to compile z474 server and i get the javac is not... errors. I know that it is possible to fix it by changing environment variables but it doesnt help on my pc. It is possible to change compiler code to fix these errors (It worked in previous servers, but i dont know the exact code for 474 server). Theres current code:
@echo off @title Build javac -d bin\ src\*.java echo Complete. pause exit
And for example a 517 server that doesnt use variables:
@echo off title compile cd ../src echo Compiling net/com/codeusa/Engine.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../build/ ./net/com/codeusa/Engine.java pause
Can anyone write or paste a 474 server code that doesnt use environment variables?

item.title: Server compiler error
item.dc:creator: @ltharis45 ltharis45
item.description:
@ltharis45 wrote:

This one aint working, im getting kinda different but still variable errors. I need one that has full javac location in it like "C:/Program Files/Java/…

Read full topic

item.title: Server compiler error
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

@echo off @TITLE Thomas's Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

I use this.

Read full topic
